page.title: 04The Parish Church part 1
page.content: The church of St.Andrew is the parish church of Much Hadham. Although originally built in the 12th century, the present building dates mainly from the 13th-15th centuries. The Chancel, Nave and South Aisle were built in the 13th century and the North Aisle in the 14th century. The church has a tower which was built in 1382-1404. It is in three stages and is surmounted by a large spire. The clerestory, rooves and South porch were added in the 15th century, when many of the windows were renewed. The West door at the base of the tower is distinguished by carvings of a king and queen, by Mr. Henry Moore who lives in the village. The Rector in 1985 is Rev. Michael MacAdam, who is also Chairman of the Governors of the village primary school.
